title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to lower tax burdens for eligible taxpayers. The tax rates for taxable income under different brackets are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess over $43,050
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households have a separate tax table for their taxable income. For unmarried individuals, the tax rates on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. For married individuals (as defined in section 7703), the tax is determined based on a specific table. For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax is determined based on a specific table with different tax rates depending on the taxable income ranges. The tax rates for taxable income ranges for married individuals filing separate returns are as follows:
- Not over $21,525: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $21,525 but not over $52,025: $2,905.87, plus 25.2% of the excess over $21,525
- Over $52,025 but not over $79,275: $10,591.87, plus 27.9% of the excess over $52,025
- Over $79,275 but not over $141,575: $18,194.62, plus 32.4% of the excess over $79,275
- Over $141,575: $38,379.82, plus 35.64% of the excess over $141,575. Estates and trusts are also subject to specific tax rates based on taxable income. If taxable income is:
- Not over $1,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25, plus 25.2% of the excess over $1,750
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85, plus 27.9% of the excess over $4,050
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70, plus 32.4% of the excess over $6,200
- Over $8,450: $2,144.70, plus 35.64% of the excess over $8,450. Inflation Adjustment Conforming Amendments were made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. In 1998, various sections of the Internal Revenue Code were amended by replacing "1992" with "1998" throughout. In 1998, amendments were made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, including changes to percentages and years in different clauses and subparagraphs. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code in 1998 changed percentages in different sections, such as reducing from 39.6% to 35.64% and adjusting other rates like 15% to 13.5%. Effective dates for these changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1998. The changes to tax percentages in the Internal Revenue Code in 1998 apply to amounts paid after December 31, 1998.
